page.title: 14FARMING IN MOORSHOLM
page.content: There are 20 farms in the area ranging from 40 to 180 acres. Average size is 75 acres. 19% are rented. The primary farmland cover is grass which accounts for 78% of the total. Arable land accounts for 16% and woodland 6%. Dairy herds are combined with beef on 33% of the farms. Dairy herds alone on 25%. Beef and sheep are combined on 26% of the farms. Sheep alone on 16%. The arable produce is mainly used for the livestock. Crops which were grown in 1985 were Barley, Oil Seed Rape, Wheat and grass for silage and hay. Part of the woodland includes 27 acres owned by the Woodland Trust Reserve (Mixed hardwoods). The farms are highly mechanised and mainly family operated. Both byres and milking parlours are operated.
